posts.name: Salt
posts.cooked:
Hi friends

I’m opening this thread as a new, centralized place to share Signal group links. If you want to share Signal group links on the forum, this is the only place to do so. Group links posted in other threads will be moved here.

Guidelines

  • Unlike previous threads, this one is strictly for group links. This is to ensure that things stay organized and on-topic. If you have questions/comments for someone who has posted a group link, please send them a DM instead of replying here. Messages that are not group links will be moved/hidden.

  • Please only post links to appropriate groups. Let’s keep things clean, friendly, and safe. If we believe a link to a group containing undesirable content is posted, we will take swift action against the user who posted the link.

  • When you post a group link, please include an accurate title and short description. This helps people more easily find what they’re looking for.

Recommendations and reminders

  • We recommend ensuring your Phone Number Privacy settings are set up the way you want them to before joining or creating any public groups.

  • Remember that your profile name, photo, status (bio), and badges will be visible to everyone in the group.

  • Joining a public group puts you at a higher risk of being added to malicious groups. An attacker could add you to undesirable groups repeatedly, so please be careful.

  • To keep members as safe as possible in your group, it’s best to have “who can add members” and “who can edit group info” both set to “only admins”, and for the group link to have admin approval enabled. Having admins you trust that are active in different timezones may also be beneficial.

Warning: Please be cautious of joining public groups

We cannot moderate Signal groups. Please be careful and join these groups at your own risk. If you believe a group contains undesirable or illegal content, please flag the post that contains the link. We are unable to control or even view what happens in these groups, so we cannot guarantee that content in these groups follows community guidelines and local regulations. Please be safe!

If you have been exposed to a spammer, the Privacy tips - Signal Wiki article may help.

This topic was created by volunteer community moderators. We do not work for Signal and all opinions are our own. This is an UNOFFICIAL collection of Signal group links. Groups cannot be moderated, please be cautious and proceed at your own risk.

posts.cooked:
Memes!

  • Post memes
  • No NSFW/illegal content/spam/advertising of any kind (instant ban) this includes in fellow members’ DMs
  • Signal groups currently are paced slower than what you may be used to. It’s best to not be discouraged and leave if messages don’t come immediately.

The approval system is to prevent spam/illegal posters from flooding the chat.

posts.cooked:
Global OpenStreetMap group.

Questions/discussions about editors and tagging or relations. You can tell/ask about funny or interesting stories that you had while mapping outdoors (with neighbours, police) etc.

This is not a channel of official OSM communication, refer to IRC and mailinglist instead. Only on-topic and mostly in English
List of OSM centric Signal accounts - OpenStreetMap Wiki for other groups.

posts.cooked:
Signal Group here’s a group for discussing archaeology & prehistory. poverty point, hoabinhians, denisovans. population movements, glacial melts, subsistence ecology. middens and megaliths.

do not:

  • post any kind of bigotry: race, gender, transphobia, etc
  • derail the discussion with fringe theory. no aliens or atlantis
    -be mean-spirited towards other group members

do:

  • share information, articles, publications, resources
  • approach the world with curiousity, ask questions & be willing to share what you know
  • engage in good faith

posts.cooked:
Self-Discipline and Procrastination

Unnecessarily and voluntarily delaying or postponing something despite knowing that there will be negative consequences for doing so?

This group has help, tips’n’tricks, and can be your controlling peers, who will help you be accountable and stay on track.

Tell (in a ciphered/nicknamed way) what you want to do and later what you really managed to do.

«Today/in the next X hours I will do task A. I will start now.»

Try to avoid discussions, be constructive.
